We have an office in SoHo & and office in Hoboken. When people would ask us how Hoboken is.. We'd say: "I mean, they have the best view of NYC." After visiting Fran's we can now say: "... And hot damn that fresh mutz." :)But, seriously- this no frills deli is super unassuming, but the food is delicious. I had the Italian salad (grilled chicken, roasted peppers, mutz, w balsamic) and it was the perfect Italian salad. There was a line during lunch, but we didn't have to wait long for food. It's super rare to find such delicious & fresh mozzarella in a NYC deli, so we are pretty excited that this deli not only exists, but is super close to the office, has tons of breakfast and lunch options & has great food/service. The deli counter girl was awesome. She was super personable & had helpful/thoughtful feedback on our orders. Can't wait to come back!

HOLY ITALIAN SANDWICHI was looking for a great lunch, and in one of those very hungry moods. I found Fran's on Yelp, and as soon as I saw a few pictures I knew this was the place for me. I purchased a gigantic delicious sandwich and walked down to the water, where I read a book and devoured the first half. It was heaven. I saved the second half for dinner and made it to about 5pm before digging in. It was delicious even after sitting in the fridge for a few hours. I can't recommend this place enough as a lunch spot!
Good and affordable Italian sandwiches. Standard menu, good quality, quick delivery and easy takeout.  What else is there to say.

A great little gem! Wonderful food, great staff. Came to Fran's when I first started working in Hoboken. Fresh, tasty lunch fare, quickly served. Fran's has an efficient crew who know how to keep the long line moving.If you haven't tried Fran's, (especially the homemade Mozzarella or Mutz), you are missing out.Recently, I started ordering lunches for my manager's day-long meetings. Fran doesn't disappoint. They get the orders right, especially the special orders, they deliver in a reasonable amount of time & the quality of the food takes the sting out of long & tiring meetings.

This Italian Deli is as good as it gets. I am second generation Italian, coming from a family of amazing Italian cooks. Everything made fresh from the garden, not over garlicky, subtle, delicate and delicious. Fran's is the same. Their chicken parm is so good, the chicken is do delicate and thin, the mutz is to die for. Their delivery is always fast and friendly. I'm so glad to have this wonderful deli in our town!

Let me start out by saying that the food is really good, but today, I wouldn't have known because it never showed up. I placed an order on GrubHub around 9:15am. They are usually really quick, which I appreciate. Today though, the estimated delivery time came and went...so I called up to see what was going on. The restaurant claimed with 100% certainty that they delivered the food, and called the phone number on the order, having left the food outside the door. The problem is, the food wasn't outside my door, and the phone never rang. The delivery address and number on the order were correct. Maybe they fat-fingered the address and phone number on the order slip when they transcribed it from GrubHub? Maybe the delivery person got lost but didn't realize it? In any case, a mistake was made, and it needed to be fixed. The restaurant refused to send the order again or refund the order, so GrubHub stepped in and refunded it instead. I will never EVER order from here again. They seemed so certain that they hadn't made a mistake, and that *I* was the one at fault. If I made a mistake, I'll own up to it...but I didn't. I double checked the info on the order in GrubHub, and it was correct. My buzzer never rang, and i have no missed calls on my phone. They claimed that some woman answered the phone. CLEARLY a wrong number....I'm a man! This was ABSOLUTELY a mistake on their part, but they seem unwilling to admit it, and make it right. That's a terrible way to run a business...treating your customers like they're trying to rip you off, and ripping them off in the process. It's disgusting, and I don't need to take this abuse. Especially in Hoboken, where there are a bunch of options. I'm done with these guys.TL;DR - The food is REALLY good, but if they mix up your delivery, they won't admit to it, and they certainly won't make it up to you. Prepare to escalate to GrubHub customer service, or your credit card company.

I LOVE Frans Deli. Period. This is an old school Italian deli, with a bunch of older Italian men hanging out any time of day. Now while that's just part of the vibe, it's authentic, just like their food. While not all of their subs are to my taste, the ones that are, they've perfected!  I love their mozzarella/mutz. The vegetarian sub with balsamic, pesto and red onion is my usual go to.  As well, they have the best egg sandwiches West of the Hudson to say the least!  Just a note, if you're not native to the tri-state area, you may not know that you can request you egg to be over-easy, or fried, or scalded, amongst other choices.  Fran's has perfected each different egg type that I have ordered - including a perfectly melted joy of cheese on top of my either bacon, egg and cheese or sausage, egg and cheese.I LOVE the fact that Fran's is still holding on strong, and remaining authentic to the true meaning of an Italian deli.  I can't wait to broaden my horizons, but I have loved everything I've ordered that I'm scared too since I only have one stomach :)

After seeing Fran's recommended highly on Yelp, I stopped in on a Thursday for lunch with a friend that I was visiting in Hoboken.After reviewing the menu, I settled on the Pesto Chicken sandwich.  They were using almost a drive through approach of order at counter one and pay at counter two.  It was easy enough.When I unwrapped the sandwich, it was a really good size.  I could see the large pieces of mutz.  The sandwich had chicken breasts, pesto, roasted red peppers, and mutz on a Italian hero.  Everything was perfect.  The salty mutz and the slightly sweet roasted peppers.  The chicken wasn't over cooked and there was lots of delicious pesto.I would definitely return to Fran's in the future when I'm up in Hoboken.

And here, it's literally the freshest I've ever had. Service was quick and nice but getting the food out took a little bit of time, even at off hours. the quality of the food is superb so I'll wait as long as needed for this deliciousness. I still remember my amazing my sandwich over a year since I first visited.  Drool..Regardless of what sandwich you get, order lots of moz!

Fran's is a great neighborhood deli. Its definitely not in the class of the better known Italian delis like Fiores, Vito's or Lisa's, but that's not a bad thing, especially if you don't want a ridiculous sized Italian sub. Prices are more than reasonable and the staff is extremely friendly, fast and attentive. If you go more than a few times a month they'll definitely catch on to your ordering habits and make the experience that much more friendly. Highly recommend if you're just looking for solid deli food at a great price.

First timer and def have to say you cant go wrong with ordering a sandwich here. And forget about be all healthy and getting a wrap cause this place has bangin focacccia bread! had grilled chicken, mutz, spinach and roasted peppers pressed in focaccia. Busy place alot of people were stoping in and ordering to go. maybe outdated inside but who cares cause service and food is thumbs way up!
My husband and I are visiting from California and this was our first time at Fran's!! By far THE BEST DELI AND SANDWICHES we've ever had!!!

I gotta say I've passed Fran's deli about a thousand times and never went in.   Recently ive been waking up early and they deliver starting at 7am.  The food has been consistently good and I have been recommending it to everyone. Keep up the good work!

We order from here for lunch frequently.  We had exactly one issue with sandwich labeling (understandable for a big office order). Otherwise this place is good and fast. I typically go for the fresh mozzarella, sun dried, and chicken.

If you like cold chicken cutlet just order the "dan",gave this place a chance after previously getting a cold chicken sandwich now today i got a   pretty subpar sub and will never ever order from here again!

We order lunch from them 1-2 times a week but they don't really appreciate our business at all. I understand that they must be very busy during the lunch hours, however, telling you're too busy to put extra toppings on an order is unprofessional. Also, If your delivery service is delayed, giving us a heads up wouldn't hurt. Simply put, Great food, unprofessional service.

I've been looking for a place around the area that made heros like I'm used to in Brooklyn ny. Closest I've come to finding a place in a while! Large portions of real  fresh deli meat and homemade mozzarella. Pleased with time of silvery and would totally recommend . Will be ordering from here more often !

2nd best deli in town other than fiore's.  Sandwiches are always well made and bread is probably top 2 in town.  Can't go wrong with the hot or cold sandwiches.  Try the godfather i think its called.  Very good.Mutz tastes like every other mutz in town, so can't judge that but overall a very pleasant experience.
I ordered the roast beef and gravy sandwich for lunch and it was so delicious.I loved it and couldnt have had a better sandwich.
Great Italian sandwiches! The crowds at lunch tell the story. I would definitely go again.
Better mutz than most of the other delis in Hoboken. Sandwiches are always great too.

Wow, what a yummy panini!  The cheese in the Paisano panini is the freshest I have had in do many years!And such a courteous person at the counter.  You can have them add any extra veg for just some additional cost.Very fresh, clean & yummy food.  Loved it.

I would have given this place 5 stars after having half a custom made hero but after ordering from here an additional 4times I'd go with solid 3.5. Damn you yelp for not allowing halves. The food is always fresh, that must be said. My issue is the inconsistency with the preparation.The first sandwich we ordered was plentiful with sweet capicola, provolone and hot peppers with a good amount of mayonnaise. It has never been the same since that first time.I ordered is again and it came with barely any hotPeppers, 2/3 provolone and 1/3 capicola and slathered with mayo. Ugh . I hate having too much mayo and not enough meat to go along with it. It made it kind of inedible. I was really disappointed with the sandwich. I don't think I will be ordering from here again but maybe I will try picking up a hero so I can instruct them on how to make it. Still kind of disappointed :(

This places is a literal god send for those of us who take part of Lent....or just a vegetarian. I had the eggplant Panini on focaccia. I kid you not, I would be totally fine never eating meat if I could live off this sandwich. Bravo, Fran's, bravo!

When your body is craving some nitrates go here for classic Italian deli grub when in Hoboken. Perfectly crafted sandwiches with several bread options.Stands out as one of the best delis in a town filled with delis. Ingredients are always fresh due to high turnover. Every time I go there is a parade of locals who could eat anywhere in town grabbing a bite here - discerning city employees, cops, construction workers. Good sign.Fresh mozzarella (mutz) is wise addition to any and all sandwiches. My faves are the godfather and my own combo called the TSPP - turkey, salami, provolone and heavy pesto. Aside from the food here is the rundown for the other criteria one should judge any mom and pop deli:- Credit cards: YES which is rare for a small mom and pop place - Hours: Opens and closes very early (around 4pm) like all good old school mom and pop places who cater to locals- Ambiance: Plenty of dingy seating inside. You're not coming here for the view. Walk down the street to the park for that.- Service: Almost took away a star for service which can be cranky sometimes but after a few bites - fuggedaboudit! Sorry I couldn't resist. ;)
one of the best italian deli ive ever taste!!  hone-made mutz is a must try!!cant wait till i get to try other sandwiches!  friendly staffs and fast food prep!
Best bacon egg and cheese sandwiches ever!! So big too. My go to place whenever I'm craving one.
Came from Manhattan for a Fran's sandwich. Was blown away by the balsamic chicken and mozz sandwich! Will be back

Amazing! It's a Hoboken staple and a must if you are visiting or a local. Their mutz (mozzarella) is fresh and handmade. The bread is perfect, the right amount of crust and chew. The staff is super sweet and accommodating. If you are craving a traditional Italian sub, an eggplant Parmesan, etc Fran's is a must

These are the type of spots that make you say maybe the world still is a great place. One of a kind deli with one of a kind people. They make regulars feel like family, and they aren't a chain that tries to squeeze every penny out of you. Oh and did I mention the mutz?

I can surely imagine they have many, many good sandwiches... The problem is, I have no choice but to order the Godfather every time. It is the most incredible sandwich, it comes with so much meat and mozz, and all for a fair price. Maybe one day I'll try something else, but it may have to wait until unforeseen circumstances like a world wide prosciutto shortage.

Good spot overall for a quick and tasty lunch, but needs to have bigger portions compared to their peers that charge the same but give more food. Pros:1. Great mutz, maybe not the best (a bit watery as they churn so much out), but good2. Good Italian sandwiches, I like the Godfather (Hot)3. Free water bottle on Monday is niceCons:1. A bit dirty inside, doesn't make you want to sit down and enjoy lunch, so take your food to the park or the water or something2. Small portions of meat, and really chewy bread (if you like that, then great, but if you want an Italian traditional style bread roll, not the place)3. Waitresses never seem happy to be there or help you, kind of depressing

Whoa! I'm usually not too big of a fan of delis unless I have breakfasts sandwiches but I was told to try their "mutz" and my god it was melt in your mouth amazing. I ordered the Paisano not thinking too much of it until I took my first bite. The bread was soft, fluffy, flavorful and melt in your mouth. The mutz was stringy and tasty. The sandwich itself seems very simple but the taste is perfect when combined with the basil. Also, having their house made cheese warm is key. Must try their Paisano.
Best breakfast sandwich in Hoboken. Period. Always fresh. Always early delivery. Always on point.

When going to a new Italian deli there is a particular sandwich that I use as a barometer.The sandwich is prosciutto and fresh mozzarella on a hero. If it is good I will go back to the place and expand on the menu. If it is not I write it off as an experience. Needless to say I will be back to Fran's. The sandwich I had today is called the "My Italian". It was the items I normally order along with sun dried tomatoes and they added balsamic vinegar at my request. It is a nice place that has about 8 to 10 tables. They serve breakfast until 10:30 Monday thru Friday and until 12:30 on the weekends. The prices appear to be more reasonable than other delis in the area. The service was great. I really liked the shirts that the workers wear which was "Got Mutz". It is convenient to get to (only about 2 blocks from the Path Station). Definitely worth a look if you are in the area.

It's so great that you can walk just one block off of Washington Street for an old school place like Fran's.  Great spot to get a freshly made breakfast or lunch sandwich. The lunch menu doesn't drift very far from Italian style so be in the mood.  They have about five tables. The crowd is new and old Hoboken. And I must mention they make fresh mozzarella daily that rivals the more famous Hoboken stores.  Self-serve coffee all day. No frills, old school, check it out.

We shared a hot pastrami and a roasted eggplant/pepper with homemade mozzarella on focaccia. Both were divine but the mozzarella/pepper/eggplant on focaccia was ridiculously delicious. Yes I said the vegetarian sandwich was better than the pastrami. BETTER! The reason?: Fran's mozzarella. It's unbelievable tender, fresh and the finish in your mouth is the best I've ever had.The bad: The sandwiches could be a little bigger. The locale is a total dive, but that's part of the charm? Wood paneling, drop ceiling, boxes of supplies in plane view, it's like going back in time. The quality of the homemade mozzarella make it a must. Totally recommended.

Is my favorite sandwich and bagel spot in town. Everything is always fresh and my order is spot on even though I don't always order the same thing. Staff is super friendly, it's no wonder why they don't have turnover.

I have been a regular here for years, often having lunch here 4 or 5 times a week.  A few months ago something changed with the quality of the sandwiches and it's been consistently bad since then.  They now put much less meat and/or cheese on sandwiches, and since it's been like this every time for the past few months it seems like it's going to be the new normal.  I have mentioned it to the owner but he hasn't done anything about it as the sandwiches remain deficient.  The hot specials are still good, but if you take away the sandwiches, that's most of the menu in my opinion.  There are a lot of good Italian delis in Hoboken.  Fran's used to be the best, but that's no longer the case.  I am very disappointed because I wanted to remain a regular customer, as I have been for years, but I can't anymore.
The sandwiches here wether it be for breakfast or lunch are outstanding and the macaroni salad is also very good ..
This place is soooo good. Love the sandwiches!  The corn muffin with butter is a must have for dessert.

One of the best Italian Delis in town which translates to one of the best in NJ. The breakfast sandwiches are the best whether it is Taylor Ham, Egg & Cheese or Bacon, Egg and Cheese. They are layered with melted cheese.

4.5 stars. The only thing holding me back from 5 stars is they forgot my hot cherry peppers and that's a very important ingredient in my sandwiches. Other than that, it was perfect. I loved the bread and the fresh mutz was great. I was so full after half of it so I prob should have quit but it was so good that I couldn't stop eating it and I ate the whole thing. They deliver too. Amazing

Lunch is, by far, the most delicate meal of the day. Once you get to work, you spend the rest of the morning trying to make it to noon. And you rely on your lunch to refuel & re-energize you for the rest of the afternoon. One mistake -- one bad lunch break -- and your day is pretty much ruined.With that said, you can understand my reluctance to try a New Lunch Place. I've had three restaurants in constant rotation in Hoboken, because I could trust them to give me a solid, reliable midday meal. I am a creature of routine. But today, I couldn't shake my sandwich craving, so a quick Yelp search brought me to Fran's Italian Deli.Online ordering? Check.Walking distance? Check.No "long line" warnings? Check.Soft bread option? BIG CHECK.Balsamic vinegar (alone) as a condiment option? SOLD.My sandwich was ready by the time I walked to the deli (about 10 mins). "I just wrapped this up!" the woman behind the counter said with a smile as she handed it to me. First impression? For a little over $7, this sandwich was as long as my forearm! And it only got better when I sat down to eat.A soft hero (!!!) surrounding a core of fresh, delicious, perfect roast beef inside a generous ring of provolone. Shredded lettuce, fresh tomatoes, and a non-overwhelming amount of onions. PERFECTION. I probably could have gone for a little more balsamic on the sandwich, and if I had eaten in-house (in-deli?), I would have asked for more. I couldn't finish the whole thing, but I gave it the old college (grad school?) try. My friends were a little jealous when they saw my sandwich, and I told them about this awesome new deli I found on Hudson Street. You've got some fans, Fran!So all in all, I was greatly impressed. And apparently I have to try the mutz?! Maybe next time. And oh yeah ... there's gonna be a next time. Welcome to the Regular Lunch Rotation, Fran's.

I cant think of any other place besides Fran's where I'd want to go to for breakfast in Hoboken. The menu is pretty basic but what makes this place great is that the staff is really friendly and the food is fresh. My go-to breakfast order is the bacon, egg (cooked over easy), and cheese on a whole wheat bun was incredible.
Amazing sandwiches, and delicious fresh mozzarella! The staff is very nice and food is out quick!

Let me preface this review: their mutz if 5 stars! Holy cow it was amazing. So buttery, so creamy, so salty. Amazing. The chicken parm hero fell flat because of the chicken. It was hard and stringy. Not matching up with that amazingly decadent freshly homemade mutz. It was almost this crazily confusing sensation where the first bite of mutz was taking me to another place but, then I would bite on this cold, hard breaded chicken and was like back on earth, sitting on my couch in Jersey City. The bread wasn't crispy either, soaked up all the sauce. Not in a bad way, but, not all together a good way.I'm not shunning Fran's for life you see, just not quick to order that parm again. But, definitely a sandwich that mutz again. Yes to the mutz, no to the chicken.*** I did order delivery, so take out may be a different story when you can eat it fresh outta the hands of who made it. Also side note: I believe they charged me $3 to deliver to JC. No biggie, but, they didn't tell me - so, just a heads up!

My office loves hitting this place up for lunch. They make an amazing hero - their signature hero is the fresh mutz (mozzarella), with prosciutto. I like to add balsamic vinegar and roasted peppers. DELICIOUS!!
A blessing for breakfast.Before work, I used to get eggs and potatoes here or a chicken parm sandwich here. Comfort food at an affordable price.

30 minutes to get 1 pastrami on rye sandwich. When I  told woman at counter how long I had been waiting she said, "next time order online." ... Next time I  will go somewhere else! No sandwich is worth wasting your whole lunch time. If you work in area and need to get back to your office quickly go somewhere else.

Fran's is my go to Italian deli!Their meats and breads are always fresh with heaping portions. My favorite is their peppercorn turkey + toppings, but today, I had a pastrami and provolone with sauerkraut and it was heaven!Their delivery is always quick as I work less then 5 blocks away and the $2 delivery fee is reasonable as I don't think they have a delivery minimum. I say this because other food delivery options in Hoboken call for at least  $15 minimum PLUS a $3-5 delivery fee. It makes tipping the delivery guy a lot easier.
The best bacon egg n cheese you can scoop in the 'Boken. No Saturday begins without Fran's.   Only complaint is they aren't open on Sunday's

I have a Frans obsession at the moment. I'll break it down per meal.Breakfast: best egg sandwich within 5 blocks from my place by the path. I get the bacon egg and cheese every time. Differentiator here is that they don't cook the eggs ALL the way through, so its perfectly yolky without the spill.Lunch/dinner: I love their chicken parm. The sauce is mildly pink and consistently delish. Mozz is amazing. I've also gotten the Frannie, which was awesome. I added pesto in addition to the balsamic and will never turn back. All around REALLY GOOD.As a reviewer had mentioned before, Panini's to go can get soggy, but that's something that's pretty difficult to avoid. All in all, I love this place. Get the 10 for 20 deal on yelp! Well worth it.

Yet another update: So after my last experience I wasn't too keen on giving these guys another shot but Jai messaged me, sincerely wanting to correct the flub, can't be too mad at that. When I called to place the order, they knew exactly who I was and why I was calling (reasons I love this place just keep piling up). I walked over to pick it up and was greeted with more sincerity in wanted to make up for my bad experience. She even remembered that I forgot chips from the last time I ordered and told me to make sure I got them this time.I left already writing a 4 star review in my head...cause I mean damn...where else do you get service like that?!I got back to my desk, held my breath, and opened the paper wrapping my sammie... ::cue the heavenly serenade:: ...the sandwich already looked a million times better than my last experience. Then I bit into it and it was the yummy mozzy deliciousness I had first grown to love from Fran's! Needless to say, I'm glad I gave them another shot. They definitely made it worth my while! I really appreciate these guys. They see that they might have slipped a bit and truly and honestly want to make it right. Seriously, the service from this place is in a league of its own. I can't wait to go back. I feel like I'm coming home!

Awesome sandwiches! I had one of their signature sandwiches - the pesto. Real chicken cutlet and fresh mozz! New favorite since fiores is now too far of a walk from where I live.  They have shrimp and chicken parm on Fridays. Will try them next time! Only complaint is that they close at 3pm. :(
When the food came out I was completely surprised by the portions! Cant beat the price and the amount of food! Friendly staff and a great classic sandwich!

Fran's is our go-to place for Mozzarella...the fresh kind!There are several places that serve fresh Mozzarella in Hoboken. One is Fiore Deli and the place is mondo good and I"ll review Fiore in a bit, and M & P Biancamano, yet to be visited.But this about Fran's. And the thing I was happy about besides the food was this:A Friendly crew. I mean friendly. Impressive...helpful too!Our first time there, we asked about the "mutz" and they told us how they serve it and they were VERY kind to throw in some bread at my behest (the place was closing and getting rid of the day-old was a no-brainer).  Seeing their kindness, I bought even MORE mutz and more bread. I mean, Hey! If you find people that take care of you, well, you take care of them, right?Now at $10/Pound for the mozz/mutz, you don't get TOO crazy but we walked away with another pound (three in total) and the bought bread to go with the gifted bread that made toasted points w/olive oil with the mutz that evening as well as sandwiches the next day. Fiore Deli is good for what it does, in fact, the best. See my review of them. But the mutz edge goes to Fran's where the salt/moisture (slightly more salt, slightly less moisture) suits us best.We'll be hitting up M & P Biancamano soon! We heard it has mutz too :)

I have worked a few blocks away from here for over a year now and stupidly just had my very first visit, wish I had come so much sooner! I used to go to JP's because it was closer to my office, but was never thrilled with their sandwiches. So I decided to walk a few more blocks and I am SO glad I did. The sandwiches are amazing {I got turkey and provolone on a hero}, prices are super reasonable, and the people who work there are extremely friendly. The turkey to cheese ratio is perfect. {some places really skimp out on the turkey} Not to mention on Wednesdays they have free chip day?! Sold. I will be coming here weekly for my sandwiches from now on.

Since my company moved to Hoboken a few months ago, Fran's has been our go-to lunch spot for pretty much any occasion: lunch with coworkers, lunch for meetings, all of it. You really can't go wrong here. The mozzarella is amazing, but everything I've tried has been great. My favorites are probably the paisano panini (mozzarella, tomato, basil) and the pesto hero (chicken, pesto, roasted red peppers, mozzarella). The salads are pretty good too, if you're looking for a lighter option. So far, this is my favorite eatery in Hoboken.Tips: I don't advise the paisano panini if you're having the food delivered. It doesn't travel well and is very soggy upon arrival. If you want to go to Fran's and pick food up (or eat there), go on the early side to avoid a long wait to order.
Excellent bread, mutz, and meat! Arrived in a very timely manner. I will continue to order from here again.

I placed an order for delivery for chicken noodle soup and a grilled cheese sandwich. It is hands down one of the best soup and sandwiches I've ever had. Beyond that though is the customer service I received there. I never caught the name of the lady I spoke to on the phone who helped me but she was so patient and helpful in answering all of my questions. She was beyond sweet and helpful and made me feel like family. The delivery service was amazingly quick too! Bottom line- great food, great service, great people I absolutely will be ordering from them again
Great bagels and can't beat the price + so nice serviceStop by and try if you are around

Love this place. Great local sandwich shop. Their sandwiches with mutz (fresh mozzarella) are out of this world. I usually go with the godfather or one with chicken cutlets on it. Their side salads are also very good. My only gripe with this place is that on some sandwiches, sometimes the bread can be a little tough. Don't let that deter you though. This place is a Hoboken staple when it comes to deli's.

If you live or work in Hoboken and Fran's isn't already a regular lunch option for you, that should change. This place is awesome. I'll start with the service. The people that work here are very nice and attentive. They have free water on Mondays and free chips on Wednesdays, and after three or four trips to Fran's, they'll already remember your name. It's very mom-and-pop and old-fashioned in that sense, and I really appreciate it.As for the food, very fresh ingredients. The mutz is great, very tender. A model Italian sub shop. Everything I've had from here has been good. It's not the best sub shop I've ever been to though. That designation still goes to Mr. Sub in Union. Mr. Sub may not have toppings like avocado and chipotle mayo, but it's the best example of a regular ol' sub I've ever had. Fran's excels though at Italian subs with ingredients like roasted peppers, pesto, and mutz. For something simple like a turkey and cheese, I've had better, but you can't beat Fran's for an Italian sub.

The food here is pretty good. The mutz is excellent. The chicken parm is a big, gooey mess.The problem is actually going here. It's not a pleasant place to sit and eat, because it gets super busy and crowded, and people waiting for their food take up all the space. The food takes awhile to come out, so you can plan to wait for awhile. The ordering process is basically chaos, which is a pet peeve of mine. Where do you order, and from whom? When do you pay? It's not clear and not consistent. Sometimes they take your name and shout it when your order is ready, sometimes they don't and just shout out the order. Hopefully no one else ordered the same thing you did!I once tried ordering online to forgo all this craziness and to save time, but when I did that they didn't start making my order until I showed up and asked for it, so it didn't help much at all.The hours are also very limited. They're open for breakfast and lunch during the week, and that's it. Apparently they're open on Saturdays, though I've never noticed.I prefer Luca Brasi's, but Fran's is much closer. So I still grab a parm for lunch there once in awhile.
Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. I did the "create your own" with Canadian bacon, egg, cheese, tomato and onion on a roll and it was fantastic! And delivery was quick.

One of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten. Everything was so fresh. I told my roommate that she had to try a bite and after she did, her response was "oh my god, can I please have another?!" Good stuff!

I love Fran's a little too much. I'm glad I live in Weehawken because otherwise I'd be morbidly obese, and it would be all Fran's fault.The bread. THE MUTZ. The prosciutto. THE MUTZ.I just ate a sandwich and writing about it is making me want more sandwich (Fran's) even though I am so full I could die.And that's the thing. It's so good there is no "Gee I'm full now I think I'll stop eating."I've been ordering delivery from Fran's early mornings (yeah, I know; oddball time to crave a mutz sandwich) for probably more than a year. The staff is kind, delivery takes between forty minutes and an hour, and of course, in case you haven't understood me, the FOOD IS AWESOME.Fran is a genius.

So many people go this spot and I've been there several times... not my choice.. but when going out with coworkers, one of them swears by them.. and EVERY SINGLE TIME we go there...I come out of there saying the same thing.. THIS PLACE IS JUST NOT THAT GOOD.Food does look appetizing.. but I haven't found the quality to be out of this world. People Rant about the MUTZZZZZ.....  I rather have Fiores' in town...much much better.I found the food to be too oilly...   .. I've been here several times...  and I've tried numerous things...  and several times it has seemed to oily to me. I'm not crazy about the ambience too.  Airconditioner wasn't working last time I was there..  nothing worse than trying to eat lunch while your sweating.  And not the cleanest place. There's better places in town...

Ordered the Godfather? Other than the delivery (Thanks Eat24) took a while. (I work in the Newport Area). The food was great. Meat and cheese was fresh. The Hero bread was enormous too. When i'm working a weekend. I'll order again.
Their sandwiches are awesome. Make sure to try the MOTZ by the pound. The place is clean and staff is cute and friendly. My favorite sandwich is the Godfather.

YUCK! Who doesn't know how to cook an egg properly....seriously.  Had to toss the piece of crap in the trash just from the looks of it....fine it was only 2 bucks but seriously learn how to cook an egg...it's not that hard not to under cook the whites....YUCK.
I found mold in my sandwich. I'm disgusted. This was only my second time going there so I don't know how common this is. Just beware next time you are thinking about visiting this establishment.

This is one of my favorite spots. I order from here constantly and they have super quick delivery. Everything from breakfast to lunch is great. All of their food is so fresh. Their homemade mutz is delish.

Just tried this for the first time today and was sad it took me so long to discover this mutz haven!! The mutz is indeed fresh and delicious! This deli surpasses other local delis for many reasons, 1) the service was quick and they were nice. 2) the prices are perfect and inexpensive. 3) the bread is crusty on the outside soft on the inside. 4) the portions huge, one sandwich fed my husband and I. 5) THE MUTZ!!!! Melts in your mouth!Will be back soon!

Only came for the breakfast sandwiches since it was unfortunately closed on New Years Day, but this is one of the best bacon, egg & cheese sandwiches I've ever eaten! Cheesy goodness, a little bit of runny yolk on a fresh roll was perfect. I cannot wait to come back and try the fresh mutz and other offerings!

so dirty inside this place. I counted about 3 dead flies lying around food areas. The staff was not that friendly but considering they were busy, its understandable. I got a panini with chicken and mozz. The chicken was disgusting, I just had to settle for eating the bread and cheese.

Best salami pesto provolone sandwich I've ever had (had to ask for more of the best pesto I've ever had though).Best Chicken noodle soup I've ever had.My dad LOVED his ham/salami/provolone sandwich. My mom got a simple grilled cheese and chicken noodle soup and she LOVED that too!!! It was all so good!!! Loved loved loved it!
Good  sandwiches a little pricy for what you get bet the foods bomb!  Personally recommend chicken cutlet fresh mozz balsamic roasted peps on focaccia pressed.   Always a home run.

Came here after buying a Yelp deal that was unreal. I like this old school place for it's simple menu and very affordable prices. Plus you can go off menu without everyone going ballistic. And the counter-girls add a little flavor too. Looking forward to trying their breakfast one of these days.

*****************please read***************i just had lunch at the dump yesterday febuary 08,2017 and not only was the lady at the counter extremely rude this place is nasty! they have a out dated menu on the wall with completely different prices from what they are charging example according to thier menu my sandwich should have been 7.25 however they charged me 10.25!!! 3 increase then when i asked to see a menu where it reads 10.25 she told me she didn't have a updated menu! as if this wasn't already a horrific experience im waiting for my food in a mouse runs across the counter top!!!!! i ask for a refund in. was told no that every resturant has mice please i'm warning you don't eat here save your money for a resturant that treats you with respect and most importantly value your health i couldn't believe that was her response after seeing the mouse this was just yesterday i saw the reviews in thought i'd give it a try biggiest mistake ever this place is a dump!
SO GOOD! The 'super hero' reminded me of my favorite sandwich I used to order when living in Rome. The bread was so fresh as well as the meats and mutz!
The sandwiches were awesome and the fresh mozzarella to die for ... I had the name sake "Fran" sandwich and it was soooooo good. I definitely recommend it for those that have issues with commitment.

Chicken soup was good but a little salty. However finding a place that delivers chicken soup when you're sick (Panera doesn't) is pretty key. Pickle was the size of a corn on the cob so that was a surprise. And the BLT was just ok. Would definitely consider going back for the soup alone. SUPER quick delivery at 12 on a Friday- under 20 minutes so that was amazing.

For a Deli with so many stars I was excited to get my lunch from there today. Big mistake. The egg salad was way lack than luster, don't know how anyone can ruin egg salad,  the bread was hard and sharp to chew and it came absolutely reeeeeking of cigarette smoke, I'm assuming from the driver. The smell literally wafted from the bag and filled my office that's shared with others with it's smell. I had to put the bags to the side hoping it would dissipate but to no avail. I literally felt like I was eating a cigarette that had been smoked. It was so bad I couldn't finish it and now I'm nauseous. To top it off, it took nearly two hours to get to me, and when I called, whoever answered was rude. I get it you're busy, actually no I don't get it, but okay, you're busy, but that's a blessing, not something you should be rude to customers about who are making you busy and hence profitable. Ugh. I don't think I've ever been so disappointed with food. Literally holy smokes!

I'm gonna give Frans the 5 star life realllllll quick. Frans signature sandwich can cure all ailments. Proven to fix cokds, hangovers, and pretty much anything. Don't even get me started on that bacon egg and cheese jaunt stuffed with a hash brown because they are that good. At least once a weekend they deliver me gods gift of a sandwich.  Respect.

I honestly want to give Fran's Deli 5 stars, and maybe I should because it is definitely my GO-TO spot for breakfast sandwiches in Hoboken and the bread & mutz are delicious.  I order delivery on Seamless and I think they know me by now because I at least order something every other week from here.  Fast delivery and friendly staff!  I hope to meet Fran in person at some point.Starting off with the breakfast sandwich. I was always kind of bummed that I had yet to find an amazing bagel place in Hoboken to get my Bacon, Egg, & Cheese on an everything bagel.  None of the places I've tried so far hit the spot.  Then one morning I decided to order a bacon, egg, and cheese from Fran's Deli on a bagel. Fran (I think it was her) called me right after putting in my order and said that they were out of bagels this morning because they had a large crowd.  She said, "Would you like it on a hero instead?" and I asked her if the hero's were good.  She said "We've got the best bread in town".  I agreed.  The bread is soft but a little crispy on the outside just how I like it and the flavor is great.  The eggs were cooked perfectly- very fresh and not overdone. Bacon & cheese just made it better.  The second time I ordered the sandwich, I got extra cheese which was just ridiculous (in a good way).I did get a chance to try a bagel from here- and it was surprisingly very good. I am really picky about my bagels, but Fran's plain bagel toasted with cream cheese hit the spot. I've definitely had better bagels in my lifetime but I have to say this was my favorite bagel so far in Hoboken!For lunch one time I ordered the Chicken Pesto sandwich with breaded chicken.  It was great and the mutz was so fresh and yummy.  The second time I ordered it, they didn't put enough pesto on it so it wasn't as flavorful as the first time. The portion is great though if you are really hungry and the food is fresh & great quality.  However- it is only open until 3:00pm on weekdays which kind of bums me out if I want something for dinner.Overall- I AM A FAN, FRAN! :)

I have gotten a few sandwiches which we're excellent. Nice portions and nice fresh ingredients. Last week I got some fresh mozzarella to go and it was terrific. I used it in some recipes at home and was very impressed.Also the server is very friendly. They even knew me by name when I went back, really nice people!I will definitely return.

Just got a couple sandwiches from here to eat out by the waterfront. We got a chicken parm and a "pesto" (chicken, mozz, roasted red peppers and pesto). Both sandwiches were huge and so delicious. The mozz on both sandwiches tasted fresh and amazing. It would probably be a 5 star review right there, but we used the yelp deal, $10 for $20 worth of food, so we also got two drinks and a bag of chips all for only $10. Amazing deal for amazing food!

The best mutz in Hoboken by far. They are always so sweet in there still, even on the busiest/hottest days of the year. Their prices are right on par too and I never have to wait too long for my order.

Ordered from these guys over the weekend, the god father hero is great! I asked what I should add to it, the suggestion was "it's very good as is" boy she was right it needed nothing added! Delivery was quick and paying with a card by phone was no problem.
The best Italian deli in Hoboken. Daily soups, the Philly cheese steak is ta die for! Cozy,  homey, and deliscioso!!!
Great place for lunch in Hoboken.  The mutz is great!!  My fav is the My Italian with Pesto.

Oh man, there is nothing better than a great sandwich for lunch.  Fran's makes great sandwiches; Fran's is a great place for lunch.I had the Godfather, a delicious collection of prosciutto, capicola, sopressatta, and mozzarella.  It doesn't get much better than that.  Additionally, on certain weekdays you will get a free drink or chips with your sandwich as part of their "customer appreciation."  Well this guy definitely felt appreciated.

The people couldn't be nicer here and the fresh mozz is so out of freakin control good...You ever have fresh mozz that squeaks when you chew it?  This squeaks when you put a knife thru it; the perfect amount of soft salty chewy goodness.  Goes great on an Italian hero...I just wish they were open late enough to pick the mozz up after work to go with tomatoes from the downtown farmer's market.  Talk about a Match Made in Hoboken...
Ordered while working down in this area, the sand which was fantastic and delivery was fast. Fine cold cuts, excellent bread, mouthwatering.
Very yummy deli sandwiches. Also close to Path so easy to pick something up on your way to the waterfront or to the city for a picnic. Good pricing and lots of options- will totally be back.
This place is great. Fast, friendly service and the mutz was excellent. Got the mutz, tomato and basil on focaccia bread. Will def be going back!!!
They offer egg whites and turkey bacon if you want to be healthy. Our order was ready quickly and the breakfast sandwich was amazing.

Fran's is my constant in Hoboken. Their breakfast sandwiches are delicious, soup is really tasty, and their salads are super filling! You get everything you'd wish for at a NYC deli at NJ prices. I love this place.
This place is great. Great rolls, great service. Best deli I've been too in Hoboken. Try the dan, if you like chicken cutlet and bacon.....oh mama

Ordered the chicken parm with mutz and co-worker ordered the Italian. My Chicken Parm turned out pretty disappointing, but luckily I split the other sandwich with my co-worker and negated my disappointment with the chicken parm. I did use the 10 for 20 deal, which I was happy about. I'm not sure if I'd be back again when Biancamano's is actually closer to me.
Awesome deli with the best mozz and bread in Hoboken. Highly recommend

I work in Hoboken, and a friend and I split the godfather hero almost every week. The sandwiches are large, so for us a half sandwich makes the perfect lunch. The mozzarella is obviously the star here--so buttery and amazing. The meats though are also of excellent quality. The staff is friendly. It is clear they have a loyal following in Hoboken, and it is well deserved.
Great place for breakfast or a quick meal in Hoboken. The prices are very reasonable too.
Awesome place!  Even told me about the Yelp deal!  Great food and great service.  Can't wait to come back!

Great food. I had the lunch special: pork loin and mashed potatoes. The prices are very reasonable. The only downside was that the dining area is small and hot. Get your order to go and walked 2 blocks over to the park and enjoy your meal on the water. I would definitely eat it again if I'm ever in NJ again.

Great yelp deal $10 for $20.  Amazing mutz sandwiches.  Got the mutz with prosciutto and sopressata, and the mutz with chicken and pesto.  Both were great on fresh bread.  Will def be coming back here.  Friendly staff.  Ooo and large salt & vinegar chips on sale for $2.

This is my go to spot for breakfast sandwiches. I think it is the only place in Hoboken to get a reliably tasty and fulfilling bacon egg and cheese with salt pepper ketchup. Unfortunately, we don't have many options for bagels in the area, so Fran's rolls will suffice with their superior flavors.

I made a previous review with only 3 stars due to that days customer service experience. Ordered a godfather the day before and a chicken parm today. Ahhhhmaaaazzzing food. And after today's experience I can say the customer service is amazing. I made an order and I wasn't aware that when ordering the chicken parm it's pre-made, I personally don't order pre-made food. I like everything fresh. This was my mistake since I wasn't aware; the girls were sweet enough to explain it to me and I requested it be redone fresh and they were nice enough to do that. I'll definitely be back and def recommending this to others. Totally worth it!!!
Best fresh muttz ive ever tasted amazing place friendly people, food is great and allways fresh, i will go back for ever just for the muttz thoe it should be awarded
Their veggie cream cheese is amazing. Made in house. Perfect sized veggies and so fresh!  Staff is friendly and very affordable breakfast!

Always always always get the mixed green with mutz salad. It's so good... Very filling.. Cannot stop eating this cheese! It's soft and fresh and just melts in your mouth.. But it's still salad so you don't feel terrible after ^_^!

Low prices, good food, and the friendliest staff in Hoboken.  Breakfast sandwich on Saturday mornings has become a ritual. Highly recommend the Pesto Chicken sub on a soft hero.Only gripe are the hours. I would eat here every day if it was open on Sundays and weekday nights.
Great sandwiches, amazing prices, friendly service. Seamless and Grubhub friendly. Enough said.

I found this place on grubhub and thought I would give it a shot. BEST decision I made! I love this place! Everything is delicious! I never had a problem with any of my orders. I've ordered from here a few times now and plan on ordering A lot more! If you have never tried this place try it now and make sure you get the fresh Mutz!

Fran's is AMAZING. I usually get the breakfast sandwich and they are absolutely delicious. My boyfriend is a mutz snob and he lovessss their mozzarella. I suggest calling your order in ahead of time because there is usually a wait time. Definitely go!

This place is a hidden gem in the vast and thriving city of Hoboken, NJ.  My boyfriend found this place from a livingsocial deal and we have returned many times for the amazing food, great service, and reasonable prices.  The food-  Possibly THE best mozzarella I've ever tasted.  Served warm and super delicious- and they always give you enough to fill yourself in two sittings (hello leftovers!!).  I've tried several different sandwiches there and have been super impressed every single time.  The service- The lady and the guy behind the counter are super nice and do their best to get your stuff ordered and served.  I don't know why, but something about a friendly face and good service makes the food taste better!! ;-)The price- For the amount of food you get for the price you pay- WOW!!  We've eaten like a King and Queen there for under $20.  And as I mentioned before, they do not skimp on the portions.  If you're ever around Hudson St near the Hoboken Terminal, make sure to stop by Fran's and have a delicious sandwich!!!

I've lived in Hoboken off and on for over 10 years, yet have only eaten at Fran's twice. Once I catered some sandwiches for a party. The grilled chicken/fresh mozz/roasted red pepper was just as good as the turkey/prov. Despite fearing I had ordered too much, I didn't even have left overs. Overall I was happy - great food and friendly service. My 2nd experience with Frans was recently, when I stopped in for lunch. Although I was originally thinking something Italian, I opted for their Roast Beef, cheese and hot peppers special. I was in Heaven. A legitimate 12 inch sandwich with quality ingredients for less than $9. Sign me up.Being a long time patron of Lisas, Luca Brasi's, and even Fiores, I'd say Frans deserves a spot among, if not above, all three.

Friendly service. Quick food. Fresh ingredients. No fuss. I walked in on a Monday after a long day at work. Ordered the #6, took a seat, and had it in hand about 8-10 minutes later. The sandwiches are simple and straightforward but fresh and delicious. Oh and they are PACKED. Like, difficult to bite into large. That's the way to my heart.

Good food, but definitely lacking in service. I recently walked in to order a sandwich, waited a few minutes to order, and was told that I would have to wait 45 minutes if I wanted anything because they just had a lot of over-the-phone delivery orders. Ok, that's fine, but why are you open if people can't walk in and order food? Didn't make much sense to me at all.

This deli wins the deli award of Hoboken's nicest staff!  They are super friendly, even when busy.  It's a nice touch.  The proscuitto, mozzarella, and roasted red pepper sandwich is great and had so much meat on it that I gave about a quarter of it to my dog (she's a big Fran's fan too now).  On Wednesdays they give away a free bag of chips with your sandwich.  Bonus!  This brought my very big and tasty lunch to $9 for the sandwich, pretzels, and an iced tea.  Good deal!
Easily the best mottz that I have ever had. The chicken soup is awesome and so is "the godfather"

Hoboken is a tough place for new delis to hold their own.  I've been here less than 2 years, and have seen places close as quickly as they open.  The fact that Fran's is making it happen is nothing short of a miracle.  The heroes are delicious and really filling.  I wasn't overly impressed with the quality of the lettuce and tomato, but the sandwich as a whole was so good that the quality of the veggies was kind of an afterthought.  The girls behind the counter were pretty cool and took care of my order fairly quickly.  They were super "Jersey", which I don't mind.  Not the best deli in Hoboken, but considering the fact that they're only about a year old, damn good.  Without a doubt the best deli in southeast Hoboken.  I will definitely be back.

Love this place, love the people that work there, love the food.  Their breakfast sandwiches are a great way to start any day, best deli sandwich menu in Hoboken, great lunch specials from chicken parm to roasted pork. One of the few (maybe only) place in Hoboken you can get a real pastrami sandwich at.  Place can be busy during the obvious hours, they get through the line fast.
Amazing sandwiches and cold cuts.Everything is fresh and delicious. Would highly recommend the chicken sandwiches or prosciutto.

The mozzarella is good, the amount of meat on the sandwich is good. This place is lacking in service beyond the acceptable prickly deli atmosphere. It's worth a try and decently quick, but could be improved.

We ordered from here for the first time as recommended by eat24 for delivery. Their customer service was great, I received a call regarding my order just to say they had no more Cole slaw and she was very kind to recommend their macaroni salad. We received our order and was very impressed with the American classic, the mozzarella was delicious. My husband loved the tuna salad sandwich and the All American. We will be ordering from here again.
The only place in town that I go to for house-made Mutz: delicious, fresh, priced right, and served with a friendly attitude! Grazie!
Great heros! Great paninis! Great salads and great breakfast sandwiches! It is my go to place for delivery. Everything they serve is so fresh, mozzarella being the best!
Excellent food and service. Great portions, prompt and friendly service. Awesome deli.

Consistently high quality food for a reasonable price. The rolls are awesome - really excellent bread (perfect balance with amount and texture of crust). I am really picky about rolls and rank these at the top. The first time I ordered from there I asked the guy what their hoagie rolls were like and he said "I'm no food critic but they are the best in the world." I actually agree with that completely. :)I usually get the tuna salad (allergic to cheese so their famous mutz is something I can't speak to) and it's always fresh and delicious. The portions are generous and I'm always full from one of their sandwiches. I've been there numerous times and have never once seen anyone working there in a bad mood or be unfriendly. They are super accommodating.  I work a block or so away so its a convenient option for lunch. My coworkers and I frequently recommend Fran's to people in town visiting. I'll definitely continue to order from there weekly.
My favorite deli in the NY Metro area.  Incredible subs, the best mutz.  The godfather is amazing.  My ONLY gripe is that they close at 3:30.  Otherwise, I'd order dinner there too.

Great service and great sandwiches. Breakfast sandwiches are good but the lunch sandwiches are what they specialize in. Been there a couple times and both the Frannie and the Godfather are sandwiches worth getting. Check out their special and don't be afraid to come on multiple occasions - just not Sunday when they are closed.
Great food! The Yelp Deal they had going helped with the cost. "The Dan" is my personal favorite. The store gets pretty busy at lunch time.
Incredible vegetarian sandwich. The mutz, the bread, the sun dried tomato and the balsamic vinegar were just amazing. This place is a must if you are even near.

Stopped by today (first time) for lunch because I noticed the $10-for-$20 deal - ended up with lunch as well as a pound of fresh mozzarella for later (not all at once .. maybe). I had turkey on sliced bread with mozz, pesto, and balsamic. The turkey was a little too lukewarm for my liking (maybe it's supposed to be like that and I'm just not refined enough to understand .. or maybe it was just out on the counter too long) so I can't say I loved the sandwich The mozz and pesto, however, were delicious and made up for the turkey. Service was kind of slow - had to wait for the register worker to end an extensive conversation before ringing me up. But considering the other reviews about great service, I'll give 'em the benefit of the doubt. Would go back next time I need a mozz fix.
Best fresh mutz in Hoboken. It's a close tie with Vito's but Fran's mutz is better overall - Vito's wins sandwiches. Great fresh deli.
Huge and very tasty sandwiches. And their mutz is amazing, get a log if you are in the area.
I used their 10 for 20 yelp deal. That being said, the sandwiches felt like a good deal even if I had paid full price.

Really great sandwiches. I'm a big pesto fan so when I heard about the well-reviewed chicken and pesto sandwich, I had to give it a try.I thought that maybe the sandwich needed a little more balsamic for some extra flavor. That's not a huge deal -- I can always ask for more next time. The real star of the sandwich is the muzz. Is it as good as Fiore's muzz? Ehhh... it's pretty darn close. But it's good enough to want to keep you coming back for more.The Godfather -- proscuitto, capicola, and sopresatta with muzz -- is another great sandwich. These guys really don't skimp on the meat. Now that my office is in Hoboken, I can see myself grabbing lunch here pretty regularly.

My first introduction to Hoboken "mutz," and I was blown away! I hate having to buy lunch, but as I walk past this place every day, I thought I'd give it a try. I do have to say I was impressed by the reasonable prices at Fran's and the fact that I got two meals out of one sandwich! Got the Godfather, and every component was delicious! And when they say that the Italian meats are hot, they mean it! So much flavor in everything, including the fresh mozzarella. Sometimes you get fresh mozz and it doesn't taste like anything but you still pay $10 for a pound because it's "homemade." This stuff here at Fran's is the real deal! Although I don't think my wallet could live to eat here too often, I'll definitely be back.
Best mutz in the world, incredible staff, and delicious food. My top recommendation in all of Hoboken. I only wish they were open on Sundays :-)

My gf and I were visiting from DC and came in search of low cost good food. Thanks to Yelp, we found Fran's, who even had a $20 for $10 coupon in addition to stellar reviews. We got the pesto chicken and the godfather and both were incredible. In addition, the service was fast and friendly - no problems using the coupon. I would gladly have paid full price and then some.
The Godfather sandwhich was so delicious and very generous portion. As for the mixed sweet & spicy meat.

There are umpteen choices for Italian deli's in Hoboken, NJ a place that I once called home.  That is one thing about this town that I really miss.  This place was called Biaggio's when I lived here, but now it is Fran's or Frannie's as it is listed on here.  Look at my picture.  It says Fran's.  Whatever.  Let's move on.I hadn't been to Hoboken since I moved out of the town in early 2006.  It was time for a visit and I knew I couldn't leave town without getting a good deli sandwich.  Was meeting 2 friends and the suggestion was made that we meet here.After driving around for what felt like hours looking for a spot (Hoboken was never an easy place to find parking before, but now with all the parking specifically for residents, it just makes us outsiders feel that much more outside) I finally found one although I was probably illegally parked.  I didn't get a ticket or a boot so that was nice.  If any Hoboken cops are reading this review, I won.Enter Frannie's.  Looks similar to what I remember it being although I can't say I spent a ton of time inside when I lived in town.  Ordered an Italian sandwich along with a Dr. Browns Cream Soda (heaven in a can).  The Italian sandwich had an assortment of meats along with fresh mozzarella and topped with lettuce, tomato, onion, sweet peppers and oil and vinegar.  The bread was some of the freshest I've eaten in a long time and the sandwich was the perfect size.  The fresh mozzarella is always a pleasure to eat and was pretty wonderful here.It was nice catching up with my friends and this is a good place to do that and enjoy a good meal.  It makes me wish my current hometown had more small ma and pa deli's like this.  I can dream, can't I?

It took me about 6 delicious iterations to find my go-to sandwich: mozz, pesto, and a bit of balsamic. The bread and the mozz are excellent.  Staff are all very, very nice and will make whatever your heart desires.If you order something with prosciutto, you're forewarned that they will pile that stuff on your sandwich.  For me, it was too much, but if you want to be in pig heaven, you're all set.

This place is amazing!  My daughter was feeling ill, so I was looking for chicken soup.  We came across this place and she loved the soup.   I ended up ordering the Godfather with some balsamic vinegar and it was amazing.  I traveled to Italy about 3 years ago and this took me back to Italy.  The meat and cheese is the best.  The service was amazing.  The lady knew my daughter was not feeling well and was very helpful.  If a place like this could be found where I live, I would never go anywhere else for deli items.  It's really the best. This place is a must try. You won't be disappointed.

Your sandwiches are good but your delivery service needs a fine tuning!  The man was incompetent and completely rude.  Also, when you make an order for a specific time online which you obviously cannot get right, make sure it's for the right time!!!!!

I initially gave Fran's a poor review due to a very, very, very delayed food delivery that happened to be my first order with them. However, I gave them another shot today and I was really impressed. The food is affordable and very tasty. Their salad came with fresh greens, excellent mozzarella cheese, and a delicious balsamic vinaigrette. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

I feel foolish for not knowing about this sandwich joint despite working in Hoboken for over a year and just two blocks away.  I just had the classic and it was BOMB.  This Mutz business is the real deal--very tender and fresh. The size of the sandwich is huge (food coma inducing if you eat the whole thing), and it is just old school Italian sub-making at its best. So refreshing in a world of Subways and Quiznos.

As other reviewers have said, this place is the hidden gem of hoboken.  Their mutz is better than any of the more celebrated joints (i.e. vito's, lisa's, fiore's).I highly recommend that you go there ASAP and try a Super Sub with their hot ham.  Truly extraordinary.  Only down side is that they are closed on Sunday.

Out of the limited Hoboken deli selection, Fran's does a solid job. Very good fresh mozzarella. Great chicken cutlets. Fresh baked bread and great customer service. Fran's is the only deli in Hoboken I go to.
Easily best deli in all of Hoboken. Every deli has a wide variety of subs, but every single one at Frans is great in its own way. It is never easy to decide which one I want to have.
Best mozz by far in town. Also get the godfather sandwich. Service is impeccable, very friendly and helpful! Love this place.

While volunteering at Hoboken High School for the Sandy Relief efforts I received a supurb dinner donated by Fran's Deli.  Dinner included Eggplant Parmesean, Chicken Parmesean, and Pasta.  She also donated fresh bread and utensils. Hoboken doesn't hurt for Italian Delis as you can find a couple on most corners.  I live uptown so I never ordered from Fran's before.  That will now change!  The meal was absolutely delicious and the donation was very much appreciated!
AMAZING Italian deli!! Food was great and the staff was very friendly! The BEST homemade mutz I've ever had!!
Keepin it short. Close to my office so I hit it often, great food and great people. Place is crazy busy for a reason.   I rarely give out fivers.  Fran's has earned it over and over.
food is phenomenal god father sub was amazing
Great sandwiches at reasonable prices. They slice the meat when you order your sandwich, they've got fresh mutz, and the people working there are really friendly.

What a wonderful experience! Everything about this place really made me happy. The service, the food, the tasting portion of mozzarella I got as soon as I walked in! You will always have a good experience here, make sure to try this place!

A hidden gem on Hudson St. The sanwiches are always fresh and piled high with meat and cheese. It has a definite mom and pop sort of vibe. The food is consistently good!I just wish they were open later than 3 PM!

A few months back I had a breakfast sandwich here that was excellent, reasonably priced and served with a smile. I was inspired to write a review based on Fran herself. While volunteering for Hoboken Sandy relief efforts Fran with 2 broken thumbs was helping pack and lift boxes and heavy bags of clothes, transport needed supplies all the way to Asbury Park and donated food for the volunteers at the high school distribution center. She donated brunch and dinner comprised of eggplant parmesean, chicken parmesean, and pasta as well as bread and utensils. The food was much appreciated. Other places might have a little better mutz, but I would give 5 stars to the deli sandwiches and the heart and soul behind the business. Thanks Fran you are amazing!

Love this place.  First they have some of the best mozzarella I've tasted.  Second,  they are super friendly and there is no intimidation factor when ordering as I have experienced at some of the more touristy Hoboken delis!  Who needs a mean grumpy old man when you have Fran and her smiling staff serving delicious mozz, chicken parm, etc.

This place used to be my absolute favorite in hoboken for fresh mozz subs and paninis. Really hasn't been as good the past few times. Willing to give it another shot though because it used to be so good.

went here today for the first time! i work right down the block at the W hotel and have never wandered here before. now im asking myself WHY! it is a true mom and pop shop/deli. nothing fancy. i ordered the godfather sandwhich. fresh mozz, and italian meats! it was wonderful!!! so filling lots of cheese and meat. it was perfect and a great price too! deff will be coming back and sending my guest at the W here as well!

YUMM!!! Used a groupon Fran is SUPER nice, helpful and accommodating . Even when they were out of many items at the end if the day she had other suggestions. Ended up being a Delish sandwich anyway! Wish the hours were later

This was a great find during a recent trip to NYC, and it is only a short walk from the Hoboken stop of the PATH train.   During my visit I noticed some of the regulars addressed my their first names.There is no doubting the quality here.  Both the antipasto and mesculn salad were great.  I wish that I had chicken added to the mesculn salad.  The Mutz was great!  Fran's offers much more than just the typical hoagie shop.  Even without the Yelp voucher, Frans's would be an excellent value.  Staff here also put their focus on paying attention to the customers, which is such a rarity today.Keep up the good work, and see you next time I get to the area.

Their sanwhochs are amazing! Their muzz is delish BUT they ALWAYS get my order wrong when I call ahead to order! It's gotten to the point I've persuaded my coworkers to not order as often as we use to because I wan't to boycott them a little lol don't get me wrong the food is great!
Not changing my review'; it's still amazing. I just wanted to give a shout out to the top-notch service here. Real friendly people behind the counter that make you feel welcome every time you go in.
Had lunch earlier today and let me tell you the fresh mozzarella here is magnificent. Staff was very friendly and helpful with all my annoying questions. I highly recommend coming here for Lunch!!!

I bought $20 Livingsocial coupon (for $10) and decided to try out the homemade Mozzarella cheese.  Kimberly & Jason were very helpful and I must say the "Mutz" quite was delicious!  It practically melts in your mouth!  I will definitely return for some sandwiches and other treats soon.

Best breakfast sandwich in town. I order their sausage egg and mutz on a bagel every time I'm there. Best mutz ever!  The bagels are better than any bagel specialty store in town. Kim is super friendly even in the busiest times of the day!
Great  food, all the time. Just breakfast and lunch, but it is excellent. Good service, get there a little before noon because it gets crowded!!

Fran's is the absolute best! Every time I go there the staff is delightful and the food is even better. In a town like Hoboken, you have to really be incredible to succeed as a delicatessen. Fran's does more than just succeed, they easily make themselves worthy of the best in town. I used to live around the corner and just moved further away. Fran's definitely is worth the additional walk. As long as I live in Hoboken ill be going to Fran's.

This place is the best Italian deli I've been to in Hoboken, definitely a hidden gem. The fresh mozzarella is unbelievable, it literally melts in your mouth. The folks taking orders were very friendly and accommodating. This was my first trip to Fran's but it will most definitely not be my last. Highly recommended!

I first tasted Frannie's in the form of a 6 ft hoagie at an apartment party. I was impressed with it as I kept eating 3 inch servings over the course of a boozey all day Kentucky Derby party. My friends live right across the street so I recently went right to the source. None of the featured sandwiches on the board jumped at me, so I decided to create my own. The gal behind the counter made a few suggestions and I walked out with my heavy brown bag anxious to rip it open.  Inside: A perfect flour-y Italian roll, cappy ham, hard salami, fresh mozz, and banana peppers. With Parisi's as my standard, I was not disappointed.

This place is a great deli, very clean, fast and fairly inexpensive. The pastrami sandwiches with mozzarella is my favorite, any type of italian sandwich is great! I've tried a few and always been pleased with the size and taste!

Good all around sandwiches and friendly staff just nothing special about the place. Anywhere else in the country this would probably be a 4 star review but the deli bar has been set too high in Hoboken. This place is very reasonably priced, especially considering that there's almost a day deal available for it. Friendly staff will go out of their way to get to know you if you go there a lot.

Fran's deli makes the best sandwiches and the staff are so friendly.  I go for the chicken pesto with fresh mozz, roaster peppers, olive oil, tomato...unreal!My only request would be to open a location in Newport because I walk every day for your food.

Fran's stands out as a more gourmet option for sandwiches at very competitive prices. My highlights were the grilled chicken pesto and the JUMBO shrimp sandwiches (the latter available only on Fridays).  There's very little space for dining in, so plan for take-out and head across the street for a waterside lunch.

Fran's - you win! :) I have yet to find as good of a local deli in NJ as this homegrown place -- thus, the fifth star. I have even made believers out of several visiting California friends after forcing them to try the Godfather (with lettuce, tomatoes and mustard).
hands down the best Italian sandwich I've ever eaten in my life- and I'm a 30 year old Italian.  Prosciutto, mutz, balsamic and olive oil... phenomenal

The Mutz is a MUST!Especially at this school, there are plenty of times when you can't even find the time to cook or even bring yourself to Pierce. There will be plenty of times when you will be busy doing papers or it will be rainy and you don't want to go anywhere, but that is when delivery will be your best friend. I don't know how many of you out there use a Facebook app called Food Frenzy by Campusfood.com, but if you haven't then you have been missing out on free money, and who doesn't like free money! You play a tile game and earn free money towards anything you order with no catch, other than minimum price restrictions. If you've played then I am sure you have seen plenty of familiar names on the list for delivery to Stevens, which is why I wanted to try something new with Fran's Italian Deli.Located far down on Hudson St, Fran's is open from 11:00 am until 3:15pm most days. A typical Italian Deli, with average lunchtime prices, I wanted to see if there was anything in particular that would set this place apart in a proud Italian community. Instead of rating the ambiance, I decided to test their delivery speed. Even with my large order, they were able to deliver to Stevens with no problem in about 40 minutes. They had called about 10 minutes after I placed an order to just clarify one item, which I appreciated since there have been a few times when I've gotten the wrong thing from an online order. The food was still warm when it arrived, which was also another pleasant surprise.As expected of an Italian deli, the majority of the menu was different sandwiches, heroes, and paninis. I wanted to get a good feel of what they had to offer so I decided to order a few different sandwiches. The first item that caught my eye was "the Pesto," which was a chicken hero with some roasted roasted red peppers and mutz. I fell in love with this sandwich at a deli near my friend's house, but Fran's had too little pesto and some tough chicken. I tried a toasted Panini of eggplant and fresh mutz, which was surprisingly delicious. I also tried one of their specialty heroes, the "Good Fella," which was buffalo, pepper jack cheese, blue cheese dressing, tomatoes and onions. It's odd balance of flavors wasn't what I was expecting, and it's lack of spice was upsetting. Their chicken parm, which was my favorite sandwich, proved that the simple combination of chicken, fresh mutz, and marinara sauce is all you really need. The mutz was so good, that I decided to order an extra pound of it, and enjoyed every ounce. While I know that I am playing right into Campusfood's Marketing Department's hands, I don't care, and neither should you! Free money is always a good thing, and I can see myself making many orders especially with senior design days coming around in the future. Fran's may not have blown me away, but it can offer a nice change of pace from the usual places that we all at Stevens go to. They sure know how to use their guns by including their delicious fresh mutz in many of their sandwiches. So if you've won some money, why not give it a shot? FREE MONEY!
